title: When "could happen" becomes "happened": operational risk turns concrete.
blurb: A cyber incident does more than add IT language. It rewrites the risk story.

title: Derailment fallout: safety and regulatory risk move to the foreground.
blurb: Risk factors shift from generic hazards to specific operational exposure.

title: Controls language tightens as investigations turn specific.
blurb: Watch the shift from boilerplate controls to named weaknesses.

title: Generative AI pressure rewires licensing risk.
blurb: The narrative moves beyond generic disruption to specific pricing exposure.

title: AI competition shifts from risk to existential narrative.
blurb: Language tightens and the tone shifts from possibility to urgency.

title: Labor risk becomes sustained and explicit.
blurb: Unionization and labor disputes become a durable risk driver.
